definition: Singles' Day (November 11), originally a day of activities for single people, but now also the world's biggest annual retail sales day
light/ray/CL:道[dao4]/bright/only/merely/to use up
stick/rod/truncheon
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]

sentences.english: "Singles day" shindig is a popular form of urban youth celebrate.
sentences.chinese: “光棍節”的熱鬧聚會是都市青年流行的慶祝形式。

sentences.english: Singles Day was first celebrated at  various universities in Nanjing, capital city of Jiangsu Province during the 1990s.
sentences.chinese: 光棍節最先在90年代的江蘇南京各大高校興起。

sentences.english: Singles' Day began as a day for unmarried or uncoupled people to celebrate their lives.
sentences.chinese: 最初光棍節是單身人士慶祝生活的日子。

sentences.english: It's the singles' day which the ninth grade had its winter trek once again.
sentences.chinese: 光棍節的今天，是附中又一次冬遊的日子。
